jobs.job_html:
Social Media Specialist

$ 7.00 - 9.00 (US Dollar)

Job Openings Social Media Specialist

About the job Social Media Specialist

Job title: Social Media Specialist
Type of employment: Full-time (Remote)
Shift Schedule: 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM PST

We’re looking for a hands-on, creative, and strategic Social Media Specialist to take ownership of content scheduling, social media calendar management, creator and ambassador partnerships, post publishing, and engagement analysis across platforms.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in social storytelling, understands trends, and can translate brand identity into high-performing social media strategies that increase reach, engagement, and followers.

About the Employer:

A design-forward lifestyle brand offering modern, functional, and safe products for babies and kids. With a strong commitment to quality and aesthetics, the brand aims to enhance the everyday lives of families through thoughtfully crafted goods. The team values creativity, collaboration, and flexibility, and is dedicated to building a consistent and engaging brand experience across multiple channels.

Company core values:

  • Teamwork

  • Transparency

  • Honesty

  • Willingness to adapt and contribute


Objectives of this role:

  • Take ownership of social media activity from strategy to executionincluding scheduling, posting, engagement, and performance reporting.

  • Maintain a strong and engaging presence on Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok.

  • Manage the ambassador program to drive user-generated content (UGC) and strengthen brand advocacy.

  • Support audience growth through consistent, trend-aware strategies that increase followers, engagement, and brand awareness.


Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and execute a social media deployment calendar aligned with the marketing and content strategy.

  • Post content consistently across Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok, ensuring timeliness and brand alignment.

  • Repurpose user-generated content and internal assets, with occasional creation of unique content for promotions or special campaigns.

  • Suggest hooks, trends, and engagement tactics to build reach, boost engagement, and support lead/customer acquisition.

  • Manage the ambassador program through LoudCrowd, reviewing and curating UGC, engaging with contributors, and aligning gifting with content needs.

  • Analyze performance metrics via native tools and third-party platforms, preparing monthly reports with actionable insights.

  • Collaborate closely with the content and design team to ensure alignment with brand identity and overall marketing goals.

  • Engage with the online community by responding to comments and direct messages.

  • Edit existing visual assets for social media use, ensuring consistency in brand aesthetics.


Required skills and qualifications:

  • At least 3 years of experience in social media management and content execution.

  • Proven experience with Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok.

  • Proficiency in Canva and/or Adobe Illustrator/Photoshop.

  • Strong written English skills; able to write clear, engaging, and on-brand copy.

  • Experience with scheduling and analytics tools (Hootsuite, Meta Business Suite, TikTok Insights, etc.).

  • Analytical mindset with ability to use data to drive decision-making.

  • Reliable internet connectivity and ability to work remotely with the team.

Preferred skills and qualifications

  • Video editing skills (CapCut, Adobe Premiere, InShot, or similar).

  • Familiarity with TikTok advertising and paid social boosting strategies.

  • Experience working with consumer product brands, preferably in the baby or maternity industry.

  • Understanding of both B2B and B2C social strategies.

Ideal Preferences

  • Empathetic understanding of the target audienceideally someone who is or has been a parent.

  • Female candidates active on social media personally, with strong awareness of current trends.

  • Self-starter with initiative, adaptable to changes in platforms, and comfortable navigating ambiguity.

  • Previous experience working with US or European brands in a similar target market.

Admin Assistant/CSR

$ 4.00 - 6.00 (US Dollar)

Job Openings Admin Assistant/CSR

About the job Admin Assistant/CSR

Job title: Admin Assistant
Type of employment: Full-time (Remote)
Shift Schedule: 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM EST

The Administrative Assistant will play a key role in supporting day-to-day operations by managing customer interactions, preparing invoices and estimates, and coordinating with property managers. This role requires strong communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills, as well as the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

About the Employer:

A plumbing service provider based in North Carolina, committed to delivering high-quality plumbing solutions for residential and commercial clients. With a growing customer base, they aim to provide efficient, reliable, and customer-focused services.

Company core values:

  • Strong work ethic

  • Open communication and willingness to speak up

  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving under pressure

  • Team collaboration and accountability


Objectives of this role:

  • Increase efficiency in daily operations by handling administrative and customer support tasks.

  • Ensure timely and professional communication with customers, property managers, and internal teams.

  • Support business growth through proactive follow-ups and outbound calls when necessary.


Responsibilities:

  • Handle customer communication through phone and email, providing professional and timely support.

  • Prepare, process, and track invoices, estimates, and other administrative documents.

  • Follow up with property managers and customers to ensure tasks are completed and customer satisfaction is maintained.

  • Make outbound calls for follow-ups, sales inquiries, and appointment coordination as needed.

  • Collaborate with the customer support representative and cross-train in related tasks.

  • Report directly to the Owner and/or General Manager.


Required skills and qualifications:

  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.

  • Sales and customer service experience, including outbound calling.

  • Highly organized, adaptable, and able to prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment.

  • Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.

Preferred skills and qualifications

  • Experience with CRM or service management tools (Housecall Pro, Service Titan, MailChimp, or similar).

  • Previous experience in the plumbing or home services industry.

  • Prior experience in administrative support or operations roles.

Project Manager

$ 5.00 - 7.00 (US Dollar)

Job Openings Project Manager

About the job Project Manager

Job title: Project Manager

Type of employment: Full-time (Remote)

Budget: $5/hr - $7/hr

Shift Schedule: 8 AM - 5 PM PST

This is a new Project Manager role at a software-as-a-service (SaaS) company. The primary objective is to serve as the central point of contact for all client communications while managing projects, tasks, and deliverables to ensure everything stays on track. The role also includes supporting lead generation activities such as cold emails, LinkedIn outreach, and proposal writing.

About the Employer:

This AI-powered SaaS development agency specializes in building custom software solutions that align closely with real business workflows and needs. Its services include SaaS platform development, internal tools and dashboards, client portals, API integrations, eCommerce solutions, and custom AI agents. Based in Southern California with U.S.-based engineers, the company emphasizes architecture-led development, milestone-based delivery, and ensuring clients retain full ownership of their code and infrastructure.

Company core values:

  • Outcome Obsessed - We measure success by your results, not our hours.

  • Speed Without Sacrifice - AI acceleration meets human expertise for unmatched velocity.

  • Radical Transparency - Clear costs, plain English, and no surprises. Ever.

Objectives of this role:

  • Provide a central point of contact for all client communications and project management

  • Maintain visibility and organization across projects, tasks, and client interactions

  • Support lead generation activities, including cold emailing, LinkedIn outreach, and proposal development

  • Ensure clear project planning, scope definition, and delivery alignment with client expectations

Responsibilities:

  • Communicate daily with clients to provide updates, address questions, and gather feedback or assets

  • Plan project scope, define deliverables, and create timelines that align with business and client needs

  • Manage tasks, resources, and deadlines using tools such as Monday.com, Slack, JIRA, and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets)

  • Monitor project progress, prepare reports, and ensure on-time, high-quality delivery

  • Serve as the “face” of the company, representing the organization in a professional, personable, and empathetic manner

  • Assist in writing, reviewing, and managing client proposals

  • Support lead generation activities (cold emailing, LinkedIn outreach, CRM updates, Mailchimp campaigns)

  • Ensure processes and workflows are well-documented, efficient, and continuously improved

Required skills and qualifications:

  • Strong communication, organization, and stakeholder management skills

  • Demonstrated ability in project planning and resource/task management

  • Proficiency with project and communication tools (Monday.com, Slack, JIRA, Google Docs, Google Sheets, CRM, Mailchimp)

  • Excellent written and verbal communication, including proposal writing

  • Ability to multitask, prioritize, and adapt to changing client needs and project requirements

  • Personable, patient, and empathetic when working with clients and stakeholders

Preferred skills and qualifications (Nice to haves):

  • Prior experience as a Project Manager, preferably in a SaaS or technology-related industry

  • Familiarity with CRM systems and email marketing tools (e.g., Mailchimp)

  • Basic understanding of software development and SaaS business models

  • Experience in workflow optimization and process improvement

Industrial Project Manager

Arizona, Arizona, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Industrial Project Manager

About the job Industrial Project Manager

Our client is seeking a hardworking, experienced professional who will oversee all aspects of their industrial mining projects. The Industrial Project Manager will be responsible for the coordination and completion of projects on time within budget and within scope as well as establishing a professional working team environment. The ideal applicant will have 10+ years on the job supervision experience in an industrial (mining) construction industry.

Job Duties and Responsibilities include but aren't limited to:

  • Must have a proven record of commitment to Safety
  • Responsible for the overall progress of the project as well as coordinate internal resources and vendors for the execution of projects
  • Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress
  • Ability to work with numerous contractors and sub-contractors in an efficient manner
  • Follow the project timeline and the given budget to ensure that deadlines are met
  • Ensure resource availability and allocation
  • Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate techniques
  • Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals
  • Responsible for orderliness on site and ensure compliance with safety regulations
  • Report and escalate to management as needed
  • Meet budgetary objectives and make adjustments to project constraints based on financial analysis
  • Use and continually develop leadership skills
  • Delegate project tasks based on junior staff members' individual strengths, skill sets, and experience levels
  • Must be an active listener, recognizing diverse perspectives and be capable of facilitating collaboration
  • Must be dedicated to supporting the team through mentoring, training, and succession planning activities
  • Clearly understand company profit expectations and the impact of them on monthly financials
  • Other job duties as assigned by management

Minimum Requirements:

  • 10+ years on the job supervision experience in the industrial construction industry
  • A valid drivers license is required upon hire and as a condition of continued employment

Xecutive Recruitment Inc

Maintenance Technician

Canton, Ohio, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Maintenance Technician

About the job Maintenance Technician

Position: Maintenance Technician Company Overview: Xecutive Recruitment Inc is a leading recruitment agency that specializes in matching top talent with the best companies. Our clients range from small startups to Fortune 500 companies, and we are committed to providing exceptional service to both our clients and candidates. Job Summary: We are currently seeking a skilled Maintenance Technician to join our team on a full-time basis. The Maintenance Technician will be responsible for performing a variety of maintenance and repair tasks to ensure the smooth operation of our clients' facilities. Key Responsibilities: - Conduct regular inspections of equipment and facilities to identify any potential issues or maintenance needs - Perform routine maintenance tasks such as changing filters, lubricating machinery, and repairing or replacing broken parts - Troubleshoot and diagnose equipment malfunctions and determine the best course of action for repairs - Collaborate with other team members to complete larger maintenance projects - Maintain accurate records of all maintenance activities and report any major issues to management - Ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies at all times - Keep inventory of maintenance supplies and equipment and notify management when replacements are needed - Respond to emergency maintenance requests in a timely and efficient manner - Continuously seek ways to improve maintenance processes and procedures to increase efficiency and reduce costs Qualifications: - High school diploma or equivalent - Minimum of 2 years of experience in a maintenance role, preferably in a commercial or industrial setting - Strong knowledge of electrical, plumbing, and HVAC systems - Ability to read and interpret technical manuals and blueprints - Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills - Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks - Good communication and interpersonal skills - Ability to work independently and in a team environment - Willingness to work flexible hours and respond to emergency maintenance requests as needed - Valid driver's license and reliable transportation Why Work for Us: At Xecutive Recruitment Inc, we value our employees and strive to create a positive and inclusive work environment. We offer competitive salaries and benefits, opportunities for growth and development, and a supportive team culture. If you have a passion for maintenance and are looking for a challenging and rewarding career opportunity, we encourage you to apply for our Maintenance Technician position. Join our team and be a part of our success in matching top talent with the best companies.

Blue Mountain Loans

Virtual Assistant

Dallas, Texas, United States

$ 48.00 - 68.00 (US Dollar)

Or refer someone
Job Openings Virtual Assistant

About the job Virtual Assistant

Job Title: Virtual Assistant

Location: Remote (Anywhere in the USA)

Position Type: Full-time/Part-time (Specify preferred hours, if any)

Responsibilities:

  • Administrative Support: Manage emails, schedule meetings, and handle correspondence.

  • Calendar Management: Schedule and organize appointments, meetings, and events.

  • Customer Service: Answer customer inquiries via email, chat, or phone (if necessary).

  • Data Entry: Maintain and update databases and CRM systems.

  • Research: Conduct market research, gather data, and assist with projects as required.

  • Social Media Management: Assist with content scheduling, monitoring social media accounts, and responding to comments.

  • Task Management: Organize and prioritize daily tasks, ensuring deadlines are met.

  • Document Preparation: Draft, proofread, and edit documents, reports, or presentations.

  • Travel Arrangements: Research and book flights, hotels, and transportation when necessary.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or in a similar administrative role.

  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace.

  • Familiar with project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana, Monday.com).

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently.

  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and manage sensitive information.

  • Knowledge of social media platforms and content scheduling tools (e.g., Buffer, Hootsuite).

  • Basic knowledge of graphic design (e.g., Canva) is a plus.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce).

  • Knowledge of email marketing platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, ActiveCampaign).

  • Bilingual (if applicable, specify languages).

  • Experience in [industry-specific knowledge, e.g., eCommerce, tech, healthcare, etc.].


Package Details

  • Salary:

    • Hourly Rate: $48 - $68 per hour (depending on experience and skill level)

  • Bonuses:

    • Performance-based bonuses

    • End-of-year bonus or holiday incentives (if applicable)

  • Benefits:

    • Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)

    • Retirement Plans (e.g., 401(k) with company match, if applicable)

    • Paid Time Off (PTO):

      • X days of vacation per year

      • Sick leave

      • Public holidays off

    • Paid Family Leave (if applicable)

  • Work-Life Balance:

    • Flexible hours (you set your schedule within [specify working hours, e.g., 8 AM - 6 PM PST])

    • Remote work from anywhere in the USA

    • Paid holidays and occasional mental health days

    • Access to mental health resources and counseling services

  • Professional Development:

    • Free or reimbursed training programs/courses

    • Conference attendance and travel expenses (if applicable)

    • Access to online learning platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Learning, Coursera, etc.)

  • Equipment & Tools:

    • Company-provided laptop or allowance for tech equipment

    • Monthly internet/phone stipend

    • Access to productivity tools (e.g., Slack, Zoom, Trello, etc.)

  • Other Perks:

    • Employee referral bonus

    • Casual, friendly, and collaborative work environment

    • Team-building events (virtual, if remote)

    • Discount on products or services (if applicable)

Recruiter

Curitiba, State of Paraná, Brazil
Or refer someone
Job Openings Recruiter

About the job Recruiter

About us:

We are a dynamic and growing organization committed to building high-performance teams that drive business success. With our collaborative and people-centered culture, we value innovation, diversity, and professional development. This is a unique opportunity to join usan organization that invests in its employees and offers career growth prospects in a supportive environment.

About the Role:

We are seeking a passionate and results-driven Recruiter to join the team in Curitiba (on-site). This role is critical to attracting, engaging, and hiring top talent at all organizational levels, from operational to strategic positions. You will play an important role in shaping the candidate experience and strengthening the companys employer brand, while partnering closely with managers to deliver effective recruitment strategies.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead end-to-end recruitment processes across operational, administrative, and strategic roles.
  • Create and post engaging job ads on multiple platforms.
  • Screen résumés, conduct interviews, and administer behavioral and technical assessments.
  • Partner with managers to define role profiles and develop attraction strategies.
  • Conduct active sourcing, hunting, and headhunting as needed.
  • Ensure a positive and memorable candidate experience throughout the recruitment journey.
  • Support and contribute to Employer Branding and talent attraction initiatives.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Psychology, Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
  • Proven experience in recruitment and selection for diverse organizational levels.
  • Fluent English (spoken and written).
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to engage with different profiles.
  • Excellent organizational skills, proactivity, and results-oriented mindset.
  • Availability to travel.

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience in multinational companies.
  • Knowledge of behavioral assessment methodologies (e.g., DISC, MBTI).
  • Experience with recruitment analytics and reporting.

Benefits:

  • A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
  • Opportunities to participate in strategic recruitment projects.
  • Professional development and career growth prospects.
  • Meal allowance.
  • On-site breakfast.
  • Transportation voucher.
  • Health and dental care plans.
  • Birthday day off.

Class A CDL Truck Driver - OTR - No Touch

Laramie, Wyoming, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Class A CDL Truck Driver - OTR - No Touch

About the job Class A CDL Truck Driver - OTR - No Touch

Long-Haul Career Opportunity with Competitive Pay and Benefits, Top-of-the-Line Equipment, and Plenty of Great Driver Rewards

Drivers Start up to $.65 CPM (dependent on safe driving experience)

Drivers also receive detention pay and layover pay

Newer Automatic Units with APUs and Inverters for easy plug-ins

No Endorsements Required

Driver will need safe place to park tractor and trailer for home time

Requirements:

  • At least 1 year of OTR/Regional (Solo or Team) experience in the past 5 years (not counting training time)
  • Current DOT Physical Exam
  • Pass Urine Drug Screen
  • No positive drug or alcohol test in a lifetime

Includes:

  • Full Benefits Including Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance and Prescription Benefits
  • 401k match
  • Paid Orientation

Call 972-265-9204 to Apply Now!

CDL-A Driver Resource provides expedited freight services throughout the continental US. We know our company is built on the backs of our drivers, and, for this reason, we treat all our drivers with the utmost respect and strive to provide our driver-partners with the care they need in this industry.

CDL-A Driver Resource has multiple facilities across the US. We pride ourselves on being one of the most reliable, fast-paced transportation services proudly servicing customers locally and nationally. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.

CDL-A Driver Resource values and promotes diversity in its workplace. Diversity refers to human differences that exist in the workplace, including those based on culture, ethnicity, gender, and age. We believe that promoting diversity plays an important role in attracting the widest pool of qualified applicants, fostering greater innovation and creativity, and enhancing our communication and relationships with customers and our CDL-A Truck Driver partners.

We diligently strive to keep the workplace free from all forms of harassment, both on the road and in the office. CDL-A Driver Resource complies with all laws prohibiting discrimination against employees and applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, genetic information, or veteran's status.

QuantigoAI

AI Data Labeling Assistant

Or refer someone
Job Openings AI Data Labeling Assistant

About the job AI Data Labeling Assistant

Title: AI Data Labeling Assistant

Industry: Machine Learning, Data Processing
Reports: Manager, Service Operations
Employment Type: Contractual
Start Date: Immediate
Salary: 70 taka per effective hour
Location: Sector 3, Uttara, Dhaka

Working days & hours (6 days a week):
# Monday, Wednesday & Friday : 09:30 am - 06:30 pm [Work from office]
# Sunday, Tuesday & Thursday: 09:30 am - 06:30 pm [Work from home]

About Us:
At Quantigo AI, we empower businesses with cutting-edge AI training data solutions, but its our people who make the difference. From data collection to annotation, our human-centric expertise ensures accuracy, scalability, and innovation across industries such as autonomous driving, retail, and agriculture. Every project is driven by the skills, creativity, and dedication of our global team. Join us, and help transform data into smarter AI, one solution at a time.

Job Overview:
In preparation for Quantigo AIs new phase of growth, we are looking to hire AI Data Labeling Assistant﻿s to join our team. The incumbent will be responsible for reviewing the annotators work and ensuring quality and identifying their strengths and weaknesses. They need to understand the project guidelines and the requirements clearly.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Analyze and review Annotators work output against guidelines/standards and provide feedback.
2. Identify Annotators' strengths and Weaknesses. Provide feedback to Delivery lead on identified areas that individual members of the team need to improve on for coaching.
3. Identify guideline ambiguities and edge-cases for each project and communicate them with the Delivery Lead and Project Management team accordingly.
4. Collaborate with the management team to ensure that best quality assurance and annotation standards are revised and updated where need be.
5. Keep an up-to-date record of individual Annotators quality performance for use in performance reviews.
6. Participate in team briefings to understand the project guidelines and requirements.
7. Prepare the Quality Assurance process as per the project requirements
8. Perform ad-hoc daily tasks when necessary. Tasks include annotations, training, onboarding new annotators, etc.

Educational Qualification and Other Requirements:

1. Graduation Degree from any discipline.
2. Freshers are encouraged to apply.
3. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and G-Suite.
4. Experience in working with a start-up will be an advantage.
5. Good communication skills.
6. Highly organized, motivated, and a team player.
7. Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
8. Able to work independently and as part of a team.

Device Specification Requirement:

It is a must that you have your own personal laptop which you can use for office purposes The requirement of the device is mentioned below:
1. Should have laptop (no desktop)
2. Core i3 processor
3. 8 GB RAM
4. All aspects of the device should be properly functional.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted via email.

Quantigo AI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religious beliefs, color, gender, sexual orientation, physical disability, mental disability, ancestry, place of origin, age, marital status, source of income or family status. At Quantigo AI we celebrate and support differences and diversity, for the benefit of our employees, our services, and our community.

San Juan, Puerto Rico

Accountant

 Job Description:

***Positions posted by El Comeback are done on behalf of companies that we support in their search for candidates.***

Our client is hiring an Accountant to support daily operations in the Finance
Department. This individual contributor role is responsible for assisting in
the invoice registration and supplier payment process, while ensuring
accuracy, compliance, and timely execution.

Salary: Base salary commensurate to candidates experience plus fringe benefits.

Responsibilities:

  • Respond to supplier inquiries related to invoices, payment schedules, and account balances.
  • Match invoices with purchase orders, delivery slips, and receiving
    reports to verify accuracy.
  • Register purchase orders into the A/P module through the Materials Management interface.
  • File invoices once processed and entered into the A/P system.
  • Prepare check vouchers for supplier and miscellaneous payments with supporting documentation.
  • Issue checks and apply "PAID" stamps to invoices and related documents.
  • Reconcile supplier account statements with the A/P ledger as needed.
  • Follow up with departments on unmatched or incomplete invoice
    documentation.
  • Maintain logs for pending invoices and assist with month-end accrual journal entries.
  • Support external audits and perform additional tasks as assigned by
    the supervisor.

Requirements:

  • Associate or Bachelor's degree
  • 1-2 years of experience in Accounting
  • Experience in Accounts Payable preferably in the health industry.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills ( English & Spanish)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word

***El Comeback is a non-profit program from ConPRmetidos that attracts and retains professional talent for Puerto Rico-based jobs. Register at elcomebackpr.org/registration-form to get matched with professional opportunities on the island.***

  Required Skills:

Vouchers Accounts Payable Operations Compliance Search Journal Entries Word Daily Operations Hiring Registration Salary Checks Spanish Purchase Orders Excel Communication Skills Payments Materials Microsoft Excel Accounting Documentation Finance English Communication Management
